philosophy_map.name: Philosophy Map
philosophy_map.description: A comprehensive map of philosophical disciplines, methods, and traditions.

central_foundation.name: Central Foundation
central_foundation.description: Core methods with which philosophy connects various disciplines and translates normal language into evaluable forms.

logic_and_philosophical_methods.name: Logic and Philosophical Methods
logic_and_philosophical_methods.description: Study of logical systems and methodological tools used in philosophy.

formal_classical_logic.name: Formal Classical Logic
formal_classical_logic.description: Traditional systems of logic focusing on valid inference.

first_order_logic.name: First-Order Logic
first_order_logic.description: Logic dealing with quantified statements over individuals.

propositional_logic.name: Propositional Logic
propositional_logic.description: Macro-logic dealing with relations between whole propositions.

categorical_logic.name: Categorical Logic
categorical_logic.description: Older system of logic analyzing subjects and predicates.

predicate_calculus.name: Predicate Calculus
predicate_calculus.description: Modern system quantifying over subjects and predicates.

higher_order_logic.name: Higher-Order Logic
higher_order_logic.description: Extends first-order logic by quantifying over predicates as well as objects.

modal_logics.name: Modal Logics
modal_logics.description: Logics dealing with modality, possibility, necessity, and related notions.

temporal_logic.name: Temporal Logic
temporal_logic.description: Logic of temporal relations: past, present, and future.

epistemic_logic.name: Epistemic Logic
epistemic_logic.description: Logic of knowledge, belief, and justification.

deontic_logic.name: Deontic Logic
deontic_logic.description: Logic of ethics, norms, and obligation.

non_classical_logic.name: Non-Classical Logic
non_classical_logic.description: Logics that deny, extend, or question the premises of classical logic.

informal_logic.name: Informal Logic
informal_logic.description: Study of reasoning, argumentation, and everyday logical practices.

inductive_arguments.name: Inductive Arguments
inductive_arguments.description: Arguments in which premises support the likelihood of the conclusion, generalizing from specific cases.

abductive_arguments.name: Abductive Arguments
abductive_arguments.description: Arguments to the best explanation, based on available evidence.

philosophical_methods.name: Philosophical Methods
philosophical_methods.description: Methods of inquiry and reasoning unique to philosophy.

thought_experiments.name: Thought Experiments
thought_experiments.description: Hypothetical scenarios designed to test intuitions and concepts.

experimental_philosophy.name: Experimental Philosophy
experimental_philosophy.description: Philosophy using empirical research to study intuitions and judgments.

intuitions.name: Intuitions
intuitions.description: Pre-theoretical judgments or impressions used as premises in reasoning.
